thread.title: Venezuela shuts off CNN in Spanish after criticizing channel's report
thread.title_full: Venezuela shuts off CNN in Spanish after criticizing channel's report

author: Associated Press
title: Venezuela shuts off CNN in Spanish after criticizing channel's report
text:
Venezuela shuts off CNN in Spanish after criticizing channel's report Associated Press 
Venezuela's government has suspended CNN in Spanish, shutting off the news channel after a report on fraudulent passports that drew angry criticism from officials. 
The country's National Telecommunications Commission announced Wednesday that it initiated the "administrative sanction" because of news stories it considered "direct aggressions" against Venezuela. 
It did not specifically mention the passport story, but earlier in the day other government officials held a news conference to dispute the CNN story. 
CNN aired a report on Feb. 6 based on a whistleblower's allegations that Venezuelan officials had been selling passports from the country's embassy in Iraq to people of Middle Eastern origin, including a few members of terrorist groups. Caption 90 seconds: 4 stories you can't miss 
Russia denies that intelligence agents were in contact with Trump's campaign team. 100,000 people living downstream of the Oroville Dam are now allowed to go home . Enrique Marquez Jr. didn't take part in the San Bernardino shooting on Dec. 2, 2015. When the pastor at a Texas church urged his congregation to embrace refugees, 300 members left .

Caption Dam operators now hope to lower Lake Oroville by 60 feet 
Even after Lake Oroville's water level is reduced by a targeted 50 feet, water managers intend to further drain the reservoir so that it can absorb major rain storms and spring snowmelt, according to state planning documents.
